result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vincent Devon Golden

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Vincent Devon Golden appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Vincent Devon Golden.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on doctors report.  State does not dispute the findings, however the defense contests the report.   Case adjourned for contested doctors report hearing.
Competency hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Email correspondence held with parties. Case is rescheduled, parties notified of new date.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Vincent Devon Golden appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Vincent Devon Golden.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
